speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: SCENE IV. The Queen's closet.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter QUEEN GERTRUDE and POLONIUS

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: He will come straight. Look you lay home to him:

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Tell him his pranks have been too broad to bear with,

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: And that your grace hath screen'd and stood between

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Much heat and him. I'll sconce me even here.

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Pray you, be round with him.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: [Within]  Mother, mother, mother!

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: I'll warrant you,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Fear me not: withdraw, I hear him coming.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: POLONIUS hides behind the arras

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Enter HAMLET

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Now, mother, what's the matter?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Hamlet, thou hast thy father much offended.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Mother, you have my father much offended.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Come, come, you answer with an idle tongue.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Go, go, you question with a wicked tongue.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Why, how now, Hamlet!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: What's the matter now?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Have you forgot me?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No, by the rood, not so:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: You are the queen, your husband's brother's wife;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And--would it were not so!--you are my mother.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Nay, then, I'll set those to you that can speak.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Come, come, and sit you down; you shall not budge;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: You go not till I set you up a glass

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Where you may see the inmost part of you.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: What wilt thou do? thou wilt not murder me?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Help, help, ho!

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: [Behind]  What, ho! help, help, help!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: [Drawing]  How now! a rat? Dead, for a ducat, dead!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Makes a pass through the arras

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: [Behind]  O, I am slain!

speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text_entry: Falls and dies

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: O me, what hast thou done?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Nay, I know not:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Is it the king?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: O, what a rash and bloody deed is this!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A bloody deed! almost as bad, good mother,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As kill a king, and marry with his brother.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: As kill a king!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ay, lady, 'twas my word.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Lifts up the array and discovers POLONIUS

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Thou wretched, rash, intruding fool, farewell!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I took thee for thy better: take thy fortune;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Thou find'st to be too busy is some danger.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Leave wringing of your hands: peace! sit you down,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And let me wring your heart; for so I shall,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: If it be made of penetrable stuff,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: If damned custom have not brass'd it so

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That it is proof and bulwark against sense.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: What have I done, that thou darest wag thy tongue

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: In noise so rude against me?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Such an act

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That blurs the grace and blush of modesty,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Calls virtue hypocrite, takes off the rose

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: From the fair forehead of an innocent love

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And sets a blister there, makes marriage-vows

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As false as dicers' oaths: O, such a deed

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As from the body of contraction plucks

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The very soul, and sweet religion makes

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A rhapsody of words: heaven's face doth glow:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Yea, this solidity and compound mass,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: With tristful visage, as against the doom,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Is thought-sick at the act.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Ay me, what act,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: That roars so loud, and thunders in the index?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Look here, upon this picture, and on this,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The counterfeit presentment of two brothers.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: See, what a grace was seated on this brow;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Hyperion's curls; the front of Jove himself;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: An eye like Mars, to threaten and command;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A station like the herald Mercury

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: New-lighted on a heaven-kissing hill;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A combination and a form indeed,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Where every god did seem to set his seal,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To give the world assurance of a man:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: This was your husband. Look you now, what follows:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Here is your husband; like a mildew'd ear,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Blasting his wholesome brother. Have you eyes?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Could you on this fair mountain leave to feed,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And batten on this moor? Ha! have you eyes?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: You cannot call it love; for at your age

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The hey-day in the blood is tame, it's humble,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And waits upon the judgment: and what judgment

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Would step from this to this? Sense, sure, you have,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Else could you not have motion; but sure, that sense

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Is apoplex'd; for madness would not err,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Nor sense to ecstasy was ne'er so thrall'd

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But it reserved some quantity of choice,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To serve in such a difference. What devil was't

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That thus hath cozen'd you at hoodman-blind?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Eyes without feeling, feeling without sight,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ears without hands or eyes, smelling sans all,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Or but a sickly part of one true sense

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Could not so mope.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O shame! where is thy blush? Rebellious hell,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: If thou canst mutine in a matron's bones,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To flaming youth let virtue be as wax,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And melt in her own fire: proclaim no shame

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: When the compulsive ardour gives the charge,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Since frost itself as actively doth burn

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And reason panders will.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: O Hamlet, speak no more:

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Thou turn'st mine eyes into my very soul;

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: And there I see such black and grained spots

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: As will not leave their tinct.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Nay, but to live

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: In the rank sweat of an enseamed bed,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Stew'd in corruption, honeying and making love

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Over the nasty sty,--

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: O, speak to me no more;

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: These words, like daggers, enter in mine ears;

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: No more, sweet Hamlet!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A murderer and a villain;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A slave that is not twentieth part the tithe

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Of your precedent lord; a vice of kings;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A cutpurse of the empire and the rule,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That from a shelf the precious diadem stole,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And put it in his pocket!

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: No more!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A king of shreds and patches,--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter Ghost

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Save me, and hover o'er me with your wings,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: You heavenly guards! What would your gracious figure?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Alas, he's mad!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Do you not come your tardy son to chide,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That, lapsed in time and passion, lets go by

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The important acting of your dread command? O, say!

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Do not forget: this visitation

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Is but to whet thy almost blunted purpose.

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: But, look, amazement on thy mother sits:

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: O, step between her and her fighting soul:

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Conceit in weakest bodies strongest works:

speaker: Ghost
text_entry: Speak to her, Hamlet.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: How is it with you, lady?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Alas, how is't with you,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: That you do bend your eye on vacancy

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: And with the incorporal air do hold discourse?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Forth at your eyes your spirits wildly peep;

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: And, as the sleeping soldiers in the alarm,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Your bedded hair, like life in excrements,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Starts up, and stands on end. O gentle son,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Upon the heat and flame of thy distemper

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Sprinkle cool patience. Whereon do you look?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: On him, on him! Look you, how pale he glares!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: His form and cause conjoin'd, preaching to stones,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Would make them capable. Do not look upon me;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Lest with this piteous action you convert

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My stern effects: then what I have to do

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Will want true colour; tears perchance for blood.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: To whom do you speak this?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Do you see nothing there?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Nothing at all; yet all that is I see.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Nor did you nothing hear?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: No, nothing but ourselves.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why, look you there! look, how it steals away!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My father, in his habit as he lived!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Look, where he goes, even now, out at the portal!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exit Ghost

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: This the very coinage of your brain:

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: This bodiless creation ecstasy

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Is very cunning in.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ecstasy!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My pulse, as yours, doth temperately keep time,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And makes as healthful music: it is not madness

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That I have utter'd: bring me to the test,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And I the matter will re-word; which madness

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Would gambol from. Mother, for love of grace,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Lay not that mattering unction to your soul,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That not your trespass, but my madness speaks:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: It will but skin and film the ulcerous place,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Whilst rank corruption, mining all within,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Infects unseen. Confess yourself to heaven;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Repent what's past; avoid what is to come;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And do not spread the compost on the weeds,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To make them ranker. Forgive me this my virtue;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For in the fatness of these pursy times

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Virtue itself of vice must pardon beg,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Yea, curb and woo for leave to do him good.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: O Hamlet, thou hast cleft my heart in twain.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O, throw away the worser part of it,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And live the purer with the other half.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Good night: but go not to mine uncle's bed;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Assume a virtue, if you have it not.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That monster, custom, who all sense doth eat,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Of habits devil, is angel yet in this,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That to the use of actions fair and good

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: He likewise gives a frock or livery,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That aptly is put on. Refrain to-night,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And that shall lend a kind of easiness

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To the next abstinence: the next more easy;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For use almost can change the stamp of nature,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And either [         ] the devil, or throw him out

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: With wondrous potency. Once more, good night:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And when you are desirous to be bless'd,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I'll blessing beg of you. For this same lord,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Pointing to POLONIUS

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I do repent: but heaven hath pleased it so,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To punish me with this and this with me,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That I must be their scourge and minister.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I will bestow him, and will answer well

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The death I gave him. So, again, good night.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I must be cruel, only to be kind:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Thus bad begins and worse remains behind.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: One word more, good lady.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: What shall I do?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Not this, by no means, that I bid you do:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Let the bloat king tempt you again to bed;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Pinch wanton on your cheek; call you his mouse;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And let him, for a pair of reechy kisses,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Or paddling in your neck with his damn'd fingers,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Make you to ravel all this matter out,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That I essentially am not in madness,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But mad in craft. 'Twere good you let him know;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For who, that's but a queen, fair, sober, wise,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Would from a paddock, from a bat, a gib,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Such dear concernings hide? who would do so?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No, in despite of sense and secrecy,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Unpeg the basket on the house's top.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Let the birds fly, and, like the famous ape,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To try conclusions, in the basket creep,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And break your own neck down.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Be thou assured, if words be made of breath,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: And breath of life, I have no life to breathe

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: What thou hast said to me.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I must to England; you know that?

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Alack,

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: I had forgot: 'tis so concluded on.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: There's letters seal'd: and my two schoolfellows,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Whom I will trust as I will adders fang'd,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: They bear the mandate; they must sweep my way,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And marshal me to knavery. Let it work;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For 'tis the sport to have the engineer

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Hoist with his own petard: and 't shall go hard

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But I will delve one yard below their mines,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And blow them at the moon: O, 'tis most sweet,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: When in one line two crafts directly meet.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: This man shall set me packing:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I'll lug the guts into the neighbour room.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Mother, good night. Indeed this counsellor

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Is now most still, most secret and most grave,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Who was in life a foolish prating knave.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Come, sir, to draw toward an end with you.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Good night, mother.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exeunt severally; HAMLET dragging in POLONIUS
